item.title: Bitcoinist Podcast: Episode 5 Available - Bitcoinist.net
item.description:
Bitcoinist Podcast: Episode 5 Available - Bitcoinist.net

The fifth episode of the Bitcoinist Podcast aired today. It's available on our RSS feed, Soundcloud, gPodder, Stitcher, and a growing number of podcasting apps and services. In this episode, My co-host, Caleb Chen and I, discuss the rise in Bitcoin's price, Jacob Appelbaum's ousting from the Tor project, Windows 10's various new security flaws, the kernel level Allwinner ARM exploit, play with drones in the background, and more.

item.title: Philippine Bitcoin fintech startup Satoshi Citadel raises seed round from K Venture Group
item.description:
Philippine Bitcoin fintech startup Satoshi Citadel raises seed round from K Venture Group

Philippine Bitcoin fintech startup Satoshi Citadel Industries has raised a seed round from K Venture Group (KVG), the investment arm of South Korea internet company Kakao Corporation. The amount of the investment was not disclosed.

item.title: A Conversation with Ed Moy, Chief Strategist at BitCoinIRA
item.description:
A Conversation with Ed Moy, Chief Strategist at BitCoinIRA

Ed Moy: I had the honor of serving the American people as the 38th director of the United States Mint from 2006 to 2011. Before that, I worked in the White House

item.title: If there's only one miner in a blockchain, can they modify the blockchain information?
item.description:
If there's only one miner in a blockchain, can they modify the blockchain information?

Answer (1 of 2): That depends on what you mean by changing and by a single miner. If you mean that the entire network is comprised of a single node (the miner), then altering the chain is trivial - the miner's view of the blockchain is the only one in existence.

item.title: Large UK businesses holding bitcoin to pay ransoms
item.description:
Large UK businesses holding bitcoin to pay ransoms

Based in Fort Lauderdale Florida, Citrix is a software corporation founded on a core principle, "to make the world's apps and data secure and easy to access." Over 400,000 organizations and over 100 million users across the globe use Citrix solutions, generating the company $3.28 billion in revenue during 2015.

item.title: Will The DAO Become Ethereum's Mt Gox? - CoinDesk
item.description:
Will The DAO Become Ethereum's Mt Gox? - CoinDesk

As stakeholders in the world's largest decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) descend into forums to debate its future, concerns are emerging about what the success or failure of The DAO could mean for Ethereum, the blockchain platform that enabled its creation.

item.title: CoinFest 2017 Announced for April 3-9 - NEWSBTC
item.description:
CoinFest 2017 Announced for April 3-9 - NEWSBTC

CoinFest, the decentralized convention for alternative currency, has been announced for April 3-9 in 2017. As decided by popular vote, CoinFest will now begin on the first Monday of April each year and last one week, further cementing the tradition of the annual event. CoinFest started in 2013, and was last held April 5-10 of ...

item.title: What do you need to do/know as a blockchain engineer?
item.description:
What do you need to do/know as a blockchain engineer?

When my dad turned 16, he wanted a motorbike. His father said that if he could afford to run a motorbike, he could afford to pay rent. My father couldn't afford both, so he got the motorbike but kept it at a friend's house.
